channel.title: Programming
channel.description: The place to talk about Runtime UnrealScript programming.

item.title: Combo Support
item.author: invalid@example.com (firekid)
item.dc:creator: firekid
item.content:encoded:
I am working on a project for a friend, and he needs me to implement combo support.

I understand that I will probably be using InputMatching and ProcessInputMatching in PlayerController and PlayerInput to accomplish this, but I am extremely new to this area of development and to this genre, How would I implement a simple combo (such as down, right, up)?

item.title: Make a Character Climb a Tree?
item.author: invalid@example.com (jburton)
item.dc:creator: jburton
item.content:encoded:
Hi all,

I have a problem i want to solve, i have a small character who's almost ready to be put into my game, here's the difficult part, i wan't this small character to climb a tree, a static mesh, and be able to scurry around it, and possibly even be able to jump from tree to tree.

The character needs to do this to negotiate certain obstacles and avoid enemies, it's quite a crucial mechanic to the game. Though not not forced to have this fully functional, i need to demonstrate some kind...

Make a Character Climb a Tree?

item.title: Can't find a key binding
item.author: invalid@example.com (Rajada)
item.dc:creator: Rajada
item.content:encoded:
I have no idea how this ended up here, I meant to post it in Unreal coding.

First off I should mention this is for a game resembling Unreal Gold more than UT.

I have a friend who claims to have a Danish keyboard and thus cannot use the Tilde key to access his console. I checked the raw bindings, but there is nothing bound to Tilde, making me pretty sure that the console dropping down and the detection of the tilde key is built into code.

Does anyone know if the command or key binding to...

Can't find a key binding

item.title: UT2004 GameBots & JavaBots
item.author: invalid@example.com (dirkmalta)
item.dc:creator: dirkmalta
item.content:encoded:
Hi All,

I am current in my final year of my BSc in Creative Computing. As a thesis project I have chosen to use the Unreal Tournament together with JavaBots and GameBots.
My aim is to create a dynamic environment which is dependent on A.I. interactions performed in real time during the game.

I am using the following Tool:
(1) JavaBots for Unreal Tournament (http://utbot.sourceforge.net/)
(2) Unreal Tournament Java Bots...

UT2004 GameBots & JavaBots

item.title: Switch player skin in UE2
item.author: invalid@example.com (Shadow_knight)
item.dc:creator: Shadow_knight
item.content:encoded:
Hi!

I posted this problem in Coding some time ago, but got no answer.

I am playing with UnrealRuntime 2 - what I want to do now is to switch player skin dynamicly (to simulate smiling or angry face by changing the texture), but it seems impossible to change the texture...

I am quite suprised the code below doesn't work.
The pawn inits with default texture - no problem there, when I call both ServerChangeTexture() and ChangeTexture() the texture actually changes but to blank...

Switch player skin in UE2

item.title: Destroy() Pawn - delay on client?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Shadow_knight)
item.dc:creator: Shadow_knight
item.content:encoded:
Hi,

I stumbled upon a following issue:
I have my custom Pawn in the level and at some point I respawn the Pawn on a different location.

The thing is that although the Pawn on the original location is destroyed, you can still see him there (it seems like the Pawn's mesh was not destroyed, or it was not replicated correctly on client). After some time the old Pawn dissapears (I noticed, when I walk behined a corner and wait there for few secs and return back, the old Pawn mesh...

Destroy() Pawn - delay on client?

item.title: Two player game (co-op) with US
item.author: invalid@example.com (allsamude)
item.dc:creator: allsamude
item.content:encoded:
Hi all,

I have now MyPawn.uc and MyPlayerController to create my first player. What i dont know is how to create another player with his own controller in unreal script, so that both players are in same viewport. Anyone can help me?

Thanks in advance

item.title: run a console command from a script
item.author: invalid@example.com (freddy83)
item.dc:creator: freddy83
item.content:encoded:
it's possible run a console command (as 'open') with a script?
and then apply this script on an object, so i can run the command touching the object or a trigger.
How i can do this?
thanks

item.title: Open an internet page in a map!
item.author: invalid@example.com (freddy83)

item.content:encoded:
It's possible to open a internet page in an unreal map?
i mean: open a page touching an object (wall, door...),
how i can do that?
Thanks

item.title: Extending MainMenu
item.author: invalid@example.com (nfactorial)
item.dc:creator: nfactorial
item.content:encoded:
I'm trying to customize the menus in the runtime, to start with I just want to amend the current menu system. First attempt was to create a 'MyTestMainMenu.uc' file and declare my class:

class MyTestMainMenu extends MainMenu;

But ucc gives me the following:

Warning: Failed to load '..\GUIRes\TestMod.u': Can't find file '..\GUIRes\TestMod.u'
Critical: appError called:
Critical: Assertion failed: FriendlyName!=NAME_None [File:.\UnClass.cpp] [Line: 679]

I've tried adding a...

Extending MainMenu

item.title: I Can't Compile...
item.author: invalid@example.com (cameleopard)
item.dc:creator: cameleopard
item.content:encoded:
I grabbed a copy of runtime and for some reason the compiler doesn't seem to do anything.

I went through this tutorial:
http://squacky.planetunreal.gamespy.com/tutorials/UnrealScript-Tutorial1.htm

and it compiled (told me it was missing gametype LastManStanding) and failed but at least it tried to do something right?

Anything else I try, including making changes to the .uc files that are included or deleting the entire Engine folder don't seem to bother the compiler at...

I Can't Compile...

item.title: about pawn
item.author: invalid@example.com (xobiscuit)
item.dc:creator: xobiscuit
item.content:encoded:
now I am making my own map and I want to put a pawn into the map. But I can just add the same pawn but cannot choose another one.
How to choose another one (in xPawn class)?

If I want to make my own pawn, what are technical problems that I need to deal with?

thank you!!

item.title: Help with getting using a mesh
item.author: invalid@example.com (CiberX15)
item.dc:creator: CiberX15
item.content:encoded:
Ok I am working with trying to create a new weapon. I have created a model and animation and I have loaded them into unrealruntime 2 (they show up and everything). I made a weapon class from the WeaponPickup class and set its display to DT_Mesh and in the animated mesh dialog I inserted my animated mesh. This worked fine and I could even place it and it would show up in the editor. However when load my map it does not load the object pack that my mesh is in, and when I do load the pack...

Help with getting using a mesh

item.title: not even triggers work!
item.author: invalid@example.com (CiberX15)
item.dc:creator: CiberX15
item.content:encoded:
What am I doing wrong? I was getting annoyed that in my scripting I couldn’t seem to get any functions to fire, so finally out of desperation I decide to look at how a trigger works. To make sure I under stood it I first set up a trigger and a trigger light to see if it would work. I told the trigger to print, “I have triggered ” on screen. When I walked near the trigger in game it printed “I have triggered” but the light didn’t turn on. Thinking maybe there was something off with the light...

not even triggers work!

item.title: need help with functions
item.author: invalid@example.com (CiberX15)
item.dc:creator: CiberX15
item.content:encoded: how do you triger a function, i know how to write a function but i cant get my pawn to exicute it. help please!

item.title: Ciber the Newb needs more help
item.author: invalid@example.com (CiberX15)
item.dc:creator: CiberX15
item.content:encoded:
Why do you have to place commands within a function e.g. I can place setPhysics(PHYS_Walk); within a function, however, if placed the command outside of the function I get an error message.
On a side note, do functions automatically run when you start the game? And if not, how would you call them since you cannot place any commands outside of a function?

Thanks for your time.

item.title: just walk you stupid pawn :(
item.author: invalid@example.com (CiberX15)
item.dc:creator: CiberX15
item.content:encoded:
How do you make a pawn walk? Shouldn’t you just be able to write something like:

Function start_walking()
{
setPhysics(PHYS_Walking);
}

I know that wouldn’t be much of an AI but so far my pawn is just standing there even though he is supposed to be using a controller I got from Angle_Mapper. Found here:
http://forums.beyondunreal.com/showthread.php?t=180799

item.title: Need help with Controllers (and pawns)
item.author: invalid@example.com (CiberX15)
item.dc:creator: CiberX15
item.content:encoded:
Ok I hope I don’t sound like too much of an idiot. I am trying to create a very simple NPC, I mean I want him to do nothing but walk forwards. I have a pawn and I think I have some idea of how a controller works, but how do you tell a pawn what controller to use? If someone could tell me how, or better yet send me an example so I can see it work I would be very grateful.

Thanks
